scandal.question: Did you try to encourage someone else to engage in a sinful behavior through your words, actions, or example?
scandal.description: Leading others to sin (also called "scandal") is sinful because it actively harms another person's soul by encouraging them away from God, making you spiritually responsible both for your own sin and for potentially damaging another's relationship with God.

impenitence.question: Have I held onto a particular sin, refusing to let go of my wrongdoing?
impenitence.description: Impenitence is sinful because refusing to repent is a prideful rejection of God's mercy.

impenitence.question: Have I refused to acknowledge my wrongdoing, even when confronted by the reality of my actions?
impenitence.description: Impenitence is sinful because refusing to repent is a prideful rejection of God's mercy.

extracted_data_phrases: from caring for someone who was ill
callousness.question: Did you turn away from caring for someone who was ill?
callousness.description: This is sinful because it violates Jesus's direct command to care for the sick (Matthew 25:36) and fails to fulfill our fundamental Christian duty to show compassion and mercy to those who are suffering.

extracted_data_phrases: for someone in your life who was seriously ill
callousness.question: Did you fail to provide adequate care for someone in your life who was seriously ill?
callousness.description: This is sinful because it violates Jesus's direct command to care for the sick (Matthew 25:36) and fails to fulfill our fundamental Christian duty to show compassion and mercy to those who are suffering.

blasphemy.question: Have you used God's holy name in vain, swearing to Him without reverence?
blasphemy.description: This sin violates the Second Commandment by treating God's holy name with disrespect rather than reverence.

extracted_data_phrases: while knowingly in a state of sin
blasphemy.question: Did I receive Holy Communion while knowingly in a state of sin?
blasphemy.description: This mortal sin is a form of sacrilege and profanes the real presence of Christ and shows grave disrespect for the sacrament by receiving unworthily.

extracted_data_phrases: in a state of grave sin
blasphemy.question: Did you receive Holy Communion while knowing yourself to be in a state of grave sin?
blasphemy.description: This mortal sin is a form of sacrilege and profanes the real presence of Christ and shows grave disrespect for the sacrament by receiving unworthily.

extracted_data_phrases: in your personal and professional life
ambition.question: Did your desire for power and dominance influence your decisions in your personal and professional life, leading you to prioritize control over humble service to others?
ambition.description: inordinate ambition and the obsession with power corrupts the soul by placing our desire to dominate and control above God's authority, turning us away from humble service and toward prideful self-exaltation.

extracted_data_phrases: in my personal and professional life
over humble service to God and those around me
ambition.question: Have I let my desire for power and dominance influence my decisions and treatment of others in my personal and professional life, leading me to prioritize self-exaltation over humble service to God and those around me?
ambition.description: inordinate ambition and the obsession with power corrupts the soul by placing our desire to dominate and control above God's authority, turning us away from humble service and toward prideful self-exaltation.

extracted_data_phrases: for influence and control in work - related decisions
over the well - being of others
ambition.question: Did your pursuit for influence and control in work-related decisions lead you to prioritize personal ambitions over the well-being of others?
ambition.description: inordinate ambition and the obsession with power corrupts the soul by placing our desire to dominate and control above God's authority, turning us away from humble service and toward prideful self-exaltation.

extracted_data_phrases: of possessions , specifically wealth and material goods
by prioritizing them over what truly gives me fulfillment
over what truly gives me fulfillment
greed.question: Did I make accumulation of possessions, specifically wealth and material goods, a dominant force in my life by prioritizing them over what truly gives me fulfillment?
greed.description: This sin makes money an idol that replaces trust in God's providence, turning what should be a tool for good into an object of worship.

extracted_data_phrases: through your words , actions , or decisions
oppression.question: Did you intentionally mistreat others through your words, actions, or decisions?
oppression.description: It's a sin to execute an unjust and cruel exercise of power or authority over others instead of respecting the God-given dignity of every human person.

extracted_data_phrases: through any unjust exercise of power or authority
oppression.question: Have I mistreated, harassed, or discriminated against others through any unjust exercise of power or authority?
oppression.description: It's a sin to execute an unjust and cruel exercise of power or authority over others instead of respecting the God-given dignity of every human person.

autonomy.question: Have you taken for granted the good things in your life, forgetting to acknowledge their source in God's providence?
autonomy.description: Believing that one's blessings are due to one's own self-sufficiency and determination is a sin as it is a rejection of recognizing Divine Providence as being ultimately responsible.

autonomy.question: Did I take for granted the accomplishments in my life, forgetting to acknowledge their source in God's providence?
autonomy.description: Believing that one's blessings are due to one's own self-sufficiency and determination is a sin as it is a rejection of recognizing Divine Providence as being ultimately responsible.

autonomy.question: Did I take credit for accomplishments in my life, forgetting to acknowledge their source in God's providence?
autonomy.description: Believing that one's blessings are due to one's own self-sufficiency and determination is a sin as it is a rejection of recognizing Divine Providence as being ultimately responsible.

envy.question: Have I secretly envied others' blessings, wishing they would lose them?
envy.description: Envy leads us to have discontent for another's possessions so we won't feel the pain of comparison or perceived lack in our own lives.

envy.question: Have I envied the blessings that others possess, and secretly wished that they would lose them?
envy.description: Envy leads us to have discontent for another's possessions so we won't feel the pain of comparison or perceived lack in our own lives.

extracted_data_phrases: with words that were hurtful , offending , or contrary to their dignity
incontinence.question: Did I lack self-control and speak to others with words that were hurtful, offending, or contrary to their dignity?
incontinence.description: This sin of incontinence shows a lack of self-restraint and violates the dignity of others.

extracted_data_phrases: in ways that disrespected others , violating their dignity
incontinence.question: Did I lack self-control and use words to speak in ways that disrespected others, violating their dignity?
incontinence.description: This sin of incontinence shows a lack of self-restraint and violates the dignity of others.

extracted_data_phrases: particularly with family members or friends
incontinence.question: Did you lack self-control and use hurtful language when engaging in conversations, particularly with family members or friends?
incontinence.description: This sin of incontinence shows a lack of self-restraint and violates the dignity of others.

extracted_data_phrases: in eating or drinking beyond what 's reasonable through my daily habits
beyond what 's reasonable through my daily habits
gluttony.question: Did I overindulge in eating or drinking beyond what's reasonable through my daily habits?
gluttony.description: This sin of gluttony demonstrates an inordinate attachment to worldly pleasures and rejects the call to temperance.

extracted_data_phrases: in eating or drinking beyond what is reasonable
gluttony.question: Did I overindulge in eating or drinking beyond what is reasonable, potentially undermining my self-control and willpower?
gluttony.description: This sin of gluttony demonstrates an inordinate attachment to worldly pleasures and rejects the call to temperance.

extracted_data_phrases: in eating or drinking beyond what 's reasonable
gluttony.question: Did I overindulge in eating or drinking beyond what's reasonable, neglecting my duty to temperance and self-control?
gluttony.description: This sin of gluttony demonstrates an inordinate attachment to worldly pleasures and rejects the call to temperance.

gossip.question: Have I taken pleasure in sharing others' private affairs, even if what I shared was true, through conversations or online interactions?
gossip.description: Gossip violates human dignity and charity by harming others' reputations for our own entertainment or pride.

extracted_data_phrases: in discussing others ' private affairs through casual conversations
gossip.question: Have I taken pleasure in discussing others' private affairs through casual conversations, even if what was shared seemed harmless?
gossip.description: Gossip violates human dignity and charity by harming others' reputations for our own entertainment or pride.

impiety.question: Did I use my talents and skills on Sunday to benefit others when otherwise it could be avoided?
impiety.description: It's irreverent to work on a Sunday as it's a holy day of rest, worship, and a day of protest against the servitude of work and the worship of money (CCC).

extracted_data_phrases: onto anger or nursed feelings of rage
rather than seeking reconciliation in my relationships with others
anger.question: Have I held onto anger or nursed feelings of rage within myself, rather than seeking reconciliation in my relationships with others?
anger.description: Uncontrolled anger corrupts our own heart, damages our relationship with both God and neighbor.
